title: 108_hr3145
content: The "Overseas Private Investment Corporation Amendments Act of 2003" amends the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 by changing the issuing authority's date from "November 1, 2000" to "2007" and includes technical corrections. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to include administrative costs and revise the noncredit account revolving fund. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to revise the noncredit account revolving fund and authorize appropriations. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to update the noncredit account revolving fund and the Board of Directors' composition. SEC. 4. INVESTMENT INSURANCE is amended to include protection against expropriation or confiscation by a foreign government or political subdivision. SEC. 5. LOCAL CURRENCY GUARANTY is also addressed in the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to include local currency guaranties for eligible investors and local financial institutions, denominated in currencies other than US dollars, to assure against loss for projects with significant developmental effects. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to define 'local financial institution' as any bank or financial institution organized under the laws of a country where the Corporation operates, excluding branches of institutions in countries where the Corporation does not operate. SEC. 6. OUTREACH TO MINORITY- AND WOMEN-OWNED BUSINESSES. Section 240 of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to include outreach to minority-owned and women-owned businesses. The Corporation will collect data on their involvement in projects, including insurance, financing, and procurement activities. This information will be included in the Corporation's annual report. The Corporation will include aggregate data on outreach activities to minority- and women-owned businesses in its annual report to Congress, quantifying effectiveness.
